author: LucMeister070
title: Would you like a strawberry pie?
review:
I decided to review this collectible minifig, because nobody has done a review on it yet.

The Gourmet Chef is an excellent figure, it introduces a new Chef's hat with female hair attached to it, which is super useful, since we can't attach hair to hats.

The strawberry pie is a redesign of the rare but well know white pie piece, I really like the strawberry prints on the pie, it finally adds some real 'flavor' to the boring pie we had before.

There is a small print on the legs, that shows the lower part of the chef's shirt. There's another tiny print on the arms, a button on each side. We get no back printing for this figure.

We get a plain female face for this minifig, nothing too special. However the light bluish gray whisk is an interesting piece, which will come in handy for kitchen MOC's. I believe it is the first time we see this piece in a Lego form.

Even though I think that the price for these figures has gone up a little bit too much, this figure is an amazing addition to my collection, especially for the pie piece. I would recommend it to people building their own Lego city, or to people wanting the pie piece :).

author: Odeinoichus
title: Bake some Pies.
review:
Set #71018 Gourmet Chef: Series 17 was a good source of brand new parts/elements, case in point this one features two great parts and an older element that hasn't been seen fairly often up to now.

The Gourmet Chef introduces a brand new head piece, a chef's hat with hair attached for female characters, or if you felt like it, male chefs with longer hair. A whisk is also included for beating eggs, this is a great new accessory piece and I'm amazed LEGO Friends did not include one, although Friends did give us the electric egg beater, so perhaps the more traditional hand mixer wasn't as high priority.

She also includes a nice Strawberry pie, for her torso print we have a plain single-sided print featuring the usual Chef style seen in LEGO City, this version is not the same though, as it includes arm printing for the sleeve cuffs and a different design on the buttons. There is very limited printing on the belt of the legs to show the lower half of the chef coat.

Overall this is a really great Minifigure and I would definitely recommend tracking one down if you missed her initially. If you want the parts I'd suggest getting a bunch as they will be of great use for your MOC ideas, I'm sure. Strongly recommended.

author: Brickstarr
title: ' I Hope she'll rise to the occasion!'
review:
Today I will be reviewing set 71018-3 : Gourmet Chef from the collectable minifgures theme. she was in series 17

Packet- The packet is a standard light blue and is dotted with white question marks. On the front.,it contains the minifgures in that series with one silhouetted with a question mark on.

Build- This is an easy build as it is a minifigure and contains 6 pieces only. She has black trousers with the bottom bit of her top printed onto it. Her torso is white with black buttons on, a traditional chef's uniform. Her face is smiling with a hint of pink lipstick. Her short brown hair is molded with the toque which I love. She also has a nicely made spatula and a delicious looking strawberry pie which is all one piece.

Overall Summary- I would give this minifigure an A* ( this is slightly bias because I love food) because of it's amazing look and its pieces, one of which is iconic to this set ( cherry pie). It is definitely worth the mere £3.00 or $4.00 that it is priced at. It would also be a good thing to put into MOCs and would go well with some of the advanced modular sets.

I hope this review was helpful

As always, Thank you for taking the time to read my review :)

Glossary:

MOCs= My own creations

Toque= The puffed-hat that a chef wears
